full_text: Plea eee Bee 2020/KER/1154 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT HRNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. DEVKISHAN, RESIDING AT 8A-8TH FLOOR, VIJAYA GLIMPS APARTMENTS, AVENUE ROAD, JAWAHAR NAGAR, KADAVANTHRA, ERNAKULAM BY ADVS. SRI. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2020, ALONG WITH Crl.MC.9244/2019(E), THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: PIE eee ees Crl.M.Cs 9243/2019 & 9244/2019 2020/KERILIS4 2 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON THURSDAY, THE 09TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 19TH POUSHA, 1941 Crl.MC.No.9244 OF 2019 (ER) AGAINST THE ORDER PASSED IN CMP 3567/2019 OF THE JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE COURT OF FIRST CLASS ,ADIMALY IN CRIME NO.877 OF 2019 OF ADIMALY POLICE STATION PETITIONER: DEEPAK, AGED 38 YEARS, S/O. DEVKISHAN, RESIDING AT 8A-8TH FLOOR, VIJAYA GLIMPS APARTMENTS, AVENUE ROAD, JAWAHAR NAGAR, KADAVANTHRA, ERNAKULAM BY ADVS. SRI.DR.MATHEW.A. KUZHALANADAN SRI.K.R.ARUN KRISHNAN SRI.SUDEEP ARAVIND PANICKER RESPONDENTS / STATE /COMPLAINANT : 1 STATE OF KERALA REP BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, -682 031 2 STATION HOUSE OFFICER, ADIMALY POLICE STATION, ADIMALY , IDUKKY-685 602 OTHER PRESENT: SRI.C.S.HRITHWIK SR. PUBLIC PROSECUTOR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2020, ALONG WITH Crl.MC.9243/2019(E), THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ae Crl.M.Cs 9243/2019 & 9244/2019 ; 2020/KER/LIS4 COMMON ORDERS (Crl.M.C.s 9243 of 2019 & 9244 of 2019) Dated this the 9th day of January, 2020 The petitioner is aggrieved by the dismissal of this application under Section 451 Cr.P.C for release of a sum of Rs.21,25,000/-(Rupees Twenty one lakh Twenty five thousand only) and Rs.5,43,000/- (Rupees Five lakh forty three thousand only) respectively seized by the Investigating Officer in Crime No.877 of 2019 of Adimaly Police Station. The petitioner is the defacto complainant in a complaint alleging offence under Section 395 IPC. The petitioner filed an application before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Adimaly for release of the amount. But the application was rejected on the ground that considering the nature of the offence and the fact that it has exclusively triable by the Court of Sessions, and that Income Tax Authorities have been intimidate regarding the seizure and therefore, clearance from the department has also to be obtained, and hence the amount could not be released to the petitioner. By sik el i a oe Crl.M.Cs 9243/2019 & 9244/2019 2020/KER/LIS4 4 2. The reasons stated by the learned Magistrate for not releasing the amount to the petitioner appears to be reasonable. But however, being such a huge amount it is always appropriate that it may be deposited in the fixed deposit earning interest, and therefore the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Adimaly, is directed to deposit the amount in an interest bearing deposit in a nationalised bank. Crl.M.Cs are disposed of as above. Sd/- ASHOK MENON JUDGE NR/16/01/20 PIE eee ees Crl.M.Cs 9243/2019 & 9244/2019 2020/KERILIS4 5 APPENDIX OF Crl.MC 9243/2019 PETITIONER'S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE-A1 TRUE COPY OF FIR IN CRIME NO.877/2029 OF ADIMALY POLICE STATION, IDUKKY DATED 26.11.2019 ANNEXURE-A2 TRUE COPY OF CMP NO.3636 OF 2019 FILED BY THE PETITIONER BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, ADIMALY DATED 28.11.2019 ANNEXURE-A3 TRUE COPY OF COMMON ORDER IN CMP NO 3567 OF 2019 AND CMP 3636 OF 2019 OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, ADIMALY DATED 18.12.2019 RESPONDENTS' EXHIBITS: NIL // TRUE COPY// PA TO JUDGE PIE eee ees Crl.M.Cs 9243/2019 & 9244/2019 2020/KERILIS4 6 APPENDIX OF Crl.MC 9244/2019 PETITIONER'S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE-A1 TRUE COPY OF FIR IN CRIME NO.877/2029 OF ADIMALY POLICE STATION, IDUKKY DATED 26.11.2019 ANNEXURE-A2 TRUE COPY OF THE CMP NO.3567 OF 2019 FILED BY THE PETITIONER BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, ADIMALY DATED 28.11.2019 ANNEXURE-A3 CERTIFIED COPY OF COMMON ORDER IN CMP NO.3567 OF 2019 AND CMP 3636 OF 2019 OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, ADIMALY DATED 18.12.2019 RESPONDENTS' EXHIBITS: NIL // TRUE COPY// PA TO JUDGE
